Site description: Lazaropole station is located in the west part of Macedonia close to the Albania border in a pristine, non-polluted part of the country. It is situated on a hill of about 1300m a.s.l. surrounded by mountains of 1400-1600 m a.s.l. The surrounding area is grassland, farmland and coniferous-deciduous forest . The area is scarcely populated only 2-3 months in summer, without polluting and non-industrialized.There are no local emission sources,particularly in distance of about 100 km from the site. Location is also away from ditect near-by emission sources. Lazaropole has a long history of meteorological and climatological observations (since 1949) and is well-known location in this part of Europe.
Climate zone: Warm temperate - Dry and hot summer
Predominant surface cover: Rainfed croplands(Surface cover types (GlobCover2009))
Topography or bathymetry: (unknown) at middle relative elevation within rises of high altitude
